fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With a Trigger configured, Bamboo will run change detection after every build. This can cause issues if code changes are checked in during a Build as new builds will be triggered until manually stopped.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option to _not_ run Change Detection after the build
 
h3. Workaround
Currently, the only option is to remove the Trigger.
fields.summary: Enable opt-out of Change Detection after build

fields.description:
Hi, 

I have implemented selenium test using maven 3.x, After test execution i am able to see failed test cases whereas what all test cases are passed during execution is not listed anywhere. Can we configure the same so that we can have pass and as well as fail test cases in build result.

Steps to reproduce-

1-Login to bamboo

2-Go to build

3-Run your Job

4-Execution of selenium test cases is bringing failed test cases only, it should also show pass test cases.

Thanks
fields.summary: Unable to see pass test cases in bamboo for a build

fields.description:
ATM Bamboo UI allows to [dedicate agent|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/dedicating-an-agent-629015108.html] to:
* Build project
* Build plan
* Build job
* Deployment project
* Deployment environment

This option is not possible to achieve via Bamboo Specs. 

As a user I want to dedicate agent to build project/plan/job/ deployment project/environment via Bamboo Specs.
fields.summary: Add possibility to dedicate an agent via Bamboo Specs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

SQL Server Integrated Authentication isn't natively supported in Bamboo 6.0.x since the transition to Microsoft JDBC from JTDS. Integrated authentication allows the driver to login to the database server using Windows / Domain authentication. The credentials are assumed from the Bamboo Service user.

{noformat}
Attempting to start Bamboo without this required library will cause an error similar to the below:
{code:java}
2017-06-22 10:52:35,163 ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] java.lang.RuntimeException: java.sql.SQLException: Connections could not be acquired from the underlying database!
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.sql.SQLException: Connections could not be acquired from the underlying database!
	at com.google.common.base.Throwables.propagate(Throwables.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.AbstractBootstrapUpgradeTask.getDatabaseConnection(AbstractBootstrapUpgradeTask.java:47)
…
Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: This driver is not configured for integrated authentication. ClientConnectionId:0147495a-6902-4d38-8253-3cf3287759df
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerConnection.terminate(SQLServerConnection.java:1748)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.AuthenticationJNI.<init>(AuthenticationJNI.java:58)
…
Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no sqljdbc_auth in java.library.path
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1867)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:870)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:1122)
	at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.AuthenticationJNI.<clinit>(AuthenticationJNI.java:32)
{noformat}
h3. Suggested Solution

Bundle the required libraries for SQL Server Integrated Authentication and provide documentation on how to enable it. Bitbucket Server example:
* [Connecting Bitbucket Server to SQL Server - Use Integrated Authentication or Windows Authentication mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/connecting-bitbucket-server-to-sql-server-776640385.html#ConnectingBitbucketServertoSQLServer-UseIntegratedAuthenticationor'WindowsAuthenticationMode'(Optional)]

h3. Workaround
(!) This workaround assumes the relevant attributes have already been added to the JDBC connection string in {{<bamboo-home>/bamboo.cfg.xml}}. Example:
{code}
<property name="hibernate.connection.url">jdbc:sqlserver://localhost:1433;databaseName=bamboo;integratedSecurity=true</property>
{code}

 # Download the Microsoft JDBC 4.2 (current version bundled with Bamboo as of 6.0.3) driver archive from: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=54671]
 # Copy the relevant DLL for your platform from the archive from either:
 ** {{/enu/auth/x64/sqljdbc_auth.dll}}
 ** {{/enu/auth/x86/sqljdbc_auth.dll}}
 # Place it in a location on the {{java.library.path}}. For Windows, this is a location on your {{%PATH%}} environment variable or {{<bamboo-install>\bin}}
fields.summary: Natively support SQL Server Integrated Authentication in Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If there are no agents online and deployments cannot be queued, we see a status message of *{{Waiting for null}}*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Since this indicates that Bamboo is unable to reach any agent to queue the deployment, use clear and relevant messaging such as:
bq. No agent is available to execute this deployment. Check the Remote Agents listing to ensure that the desired agent is currently on line.
fields.summary: Improve messaging on Deployment result page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User without global admin or restricted admin permission is not able to clone a deployment environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user and add to it all permissions in global permissions except the Admin
 # Login with this user create a deployment project and an environment
 # Try to clone the environment by going to *Deployment config >> (your_env) >> Actions >> Clone*

h3. Expected Results

Bamboo will show the next screen to set the name of the cloned environment and later will succeed the cloning
h3. Actual Results

An access denied page is shown
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-22 at 5.12.52 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * download [^atlassian-bamboo-deployments-5.15.7-BAM-18492.jar] for v5.15.7 or  [^atlassian-bamboo-deployments-6.0.3-BAM-18492.jar] for v6.0.x
 * stop Bamboo
 * move (*do not delete*) {color:#0000FF}<bamboo-install>/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/lib/atlassian-bamboo-deployments-5.15.7.jar{color} to a directory outside {color:#0000FF}<bamboo-install>{color}
 * place [^atlassian-bamboo-deployments-5.15.7-BAM-18492.jar] into {color:#0000FF}<bamboo-install>/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/lib/{color} directory
 * start Bamboo

{panel:bgColor=#e3f7fc}
Users/groups with {color:#0000FF}edit{color} permission on *Deployment project* will be able to clone an environment.
{panel}
fields.summary: User without global admin or restricted admin permission is not able to clone a deployment environment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo Specs does not yet support creating or linking to existing GitHub repositories.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement GitHub repositories for use in Bamboo Specs.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use a *[GitRepository|https://docs.atlassian.com/bamboo-specs-docs/latest/?_ga=2.159201138.993535699.1497827881-2005789593.1490846513#git]* in the interim.
fields.summary: Support GitHub repositories in Bamboo Specs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo Specs does not yet support setting a child plan dependency (*Plan Configuration > Dependencies > Child plan*) for import or export.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuration of a parent-child plan relationship through Bamboo Specs.

h3. Workaround
Dependencies can still be configured through the UI after it's been published. Subsequent publishes will not overwrite the configuration.
fields.summary: Bamboo Specs does not yet support setting a child plan dependency for import or export

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Publishing a plan from Bamboo Specs with the same Artifact Subscription multiple times will cause the subscription (Artifact dependency) to be duplicated despite the unique key of artifact / destination being identical. Example setup:
{code:java}
        Stage stage1 = new Stage("Stage 1")
                .jobs(new Job("Job1", "JOB1")
                        .tasks(new ScriptTask().inlineBody("echo hello"))
                        .artifacts(new Artifact()
                                .name("images")
                                .copyPattern("*.jpg")
                                .shared(true))
                );

        Stage stage2 = new Stage("Stage 2")
                .jobs(new Job("Job2", "JOB2")
                        .tasks(new ScriptTask().inlineBody("echo hello"))
                        .artifactSubscriptions(new ArtifactSubscription()
                                .artifact("images")
                                .destination("images/"))
                );
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the attached [^PlanSpec.java]  and publish the spec twice through Bamboo Specs.

h3. Expected Results
Only one Artifact dependency exists on the plan at *Job Configuration > Artifacts*.

h3. Actual Results
Two identical Artifact dependencies exists on the plan at *Job Configuration > Artifacts*.
 
h3. Notes
Attempting to create duplicate artifact dependencies through the UI fails. Validation is successfully enforced.
fields.summary: Artifact subscriptions published from Bamboo Specs will duplicate

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The content in this page [\_planRepositoryIncludeExcludeFilesExamples|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/_planrepositoryincludeexcludefilesexamples-289277478.html] could help users to easily understand the feature and use it

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the link to this page under Include / exclude files field in the repository configuration
fields.summary: Add link to examples in Include / exclude files repository feature

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are getting trouble to find this page probably due to its title and location location

h3. Suggested Solution
* Adjust the title of this page
{panel}Change the page title from:
*_planRepositoryIncludeExcludeFilesExamples*
to something like:
*Repository Include/Exclude Files examples*
{panel}

* Increase the visibility of this link in other pages with repository details.
{panel}E.g. in this page [Git|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/git-289277007.html] the information is inside the description at the end "_... .See sub page for examples._"
We could just add a new line with the like to examples. This would make this knowledge more visible.
{panel}
fields.summary: Make the page with Include/Exclude files examples more easy to find

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The below pages regarding remote agent security could use improvement:
* [Securing your remote agents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/securing-your-remote-agents-289277197.html]
* [Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/security-289277194.html]

For example, there's a list of there's a list of security implications with no links to remediation items or clarification, a broken link to a security advisory, no links or clarification around manually securing the agents and the secure token feature is not well described.
fields.summary: Improve the Bamboo remote agent security documentation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo 6.0.x ships with an additional library ({{javax.mail-api-1.5.6.jar}}) that needs to be moved when setting up a JNDI resource for SMTP. 

The existing documentation has not yet been updated to make reference to the new library as one that needs to be moved and only talks about {{javax.mail-X.X.X.jar}}:
* [Configuring Bamboo to send SMTP Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/configuring-bamboo-to-send-smtp-email-289276984.html]

Failure to do so will result in errors when testing the SMTP configuration such as:
{code}ognl.MethodFailedException: Method "edit" failed for object com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.admin.mail.ConfigureMailServer@15fc28f8
...
Caused by: java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraint violation: loader (instance of java/net/URLClassLoader) previously initiated loading for a different type with name "javax/mail/Session"
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
...
/-- Encapsulated exception ------------\
java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraint violation: loader (instance of java/net/URLClassLoader) previously initiated loading for a different type with name "javax/mail/Session"
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Update [Configuring Bamboo to send SMTP Email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/configuring-bamboo-to-send-smtp-email-289276984.html] to mention that from 6.0 and on {{javax.mail-api-x.x.x.jar}} needs be moved in addition to {{javax.mail-X.X.X.jar}}.

Include a note about it's inclusion and necessity to move (if using a JNDI mail resource) in the 6.0 upgrade notes on the upgrade guide:
* [Bamboo upgrade guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/bamboo-upgrade-guide-720411366.html]
fields.summary: Bamboo 6.0 ships with an additional library that needs to be moved when setting up a JNDI resource for SMTP

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo is not correctly parsing results from JUnit tests

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a build plan to parse a file similar to the following:
{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<testsuites name="Plan Tests" tests="1" failures="3" timestamp="Fri Jun 9 19:21:29 2017" time="0.010">
 <testsuite name="test suite.name" time="0.001" tests="1" failures="3">
 <testcase time="0.001" name="test.name2" checks="1">
 <failure message="error message" type="Exception failed"></failure> 
 </testcase>
 </testsuite>
</testsuites>
{noformat}
# Configure a Junit task to parse that file

h3. Expected Results
# When going to Build results summary *Job Summary* tab you will see the full testsuite name followed by the test name
# When going to Build results summary *tests* tab you will see:
||Description |"empty" or test.name2|
||Test class |test suite.name|
||Method |test.name2|

h3. Actual Results
# The Build results summary *Job Summary* shows this:
!Screen Shot 2017-06-20 at 6.43.02 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# The Build results summary *tests* shows this:
 !Screen Shot 2017-06-20 at 6.42.15 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bamboo is not correctly parsing results from JUnit tests

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[Running Bamboo Server in AWS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/running-bamboo-server-in-aws-858705568.html] covers that you can restart the EC2 stop and restart the EC2 instance. When an EC2 instance is stopped and restarted, a new public DNS gets assigned to it and can cause issues with Bamboo starting up.

The server.xml and bamboo.cfg.xml files need to be updated to reflect the new hostname. The FAQ should be updated to reflect this is needed during restart of EC2 instance.
fields.summary: Update Bamboo AWS FAQ to include that updates will need to be made to configuration when hostname changes during restart

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* User is unable to authenticate in Bamboo *when*:
** Delegated LDAP is set up in Crowd
** Bamboo is connected to use Crowd as User Management
* *unless*:
** user has previously authenticated against Crowd Application, so user can be synchronised with Crowd making it available to Bamboo

h3. Environment
* Crowd v2.9.1, v2.11.1
* JIRA v7.2.7
* Bamboo v5.15.5, v6.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Set up a {color:blue}Delegated LDAP directory{color} in Crowd
* Create a Bamboo application in Crowd using the directory from above
* Set up Crowd with Bamboo under {color:blue}Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Security >> User repositories{color}
* Attempt on login in Bamboo with a user that has not logged in Crowd

h3. Expected Results
* As per other Atlassian products, Bamboo should authenticate against Crowd 

h3. Actual Results
* User is unable to authenticate
{noformat}
2017-06-20 16:06:47,891 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-2] [DefaultAuthenticator] login : 'user0001' could not be authenticated with the given password
2017-06-20 16:06:47,892 WARN [http-nio-8085-exec-2] [DefaultAuthenticator] login : 'user0001' tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting remember me cookie.
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* Same issue happens when using JIRA instead of Crowd
* Issue *does not happen* if using Confluence instead Bamboo (_for reference_)
fields.summary: Bamboo does not authenticate against Crowd or JIRA with Delegated LDAP

fields.description:
h2. Reproduction steps:
When user tries to create Bamboo Specs tutorial project with version 6.0.3 like:

{code}
mvn archetype:generate -B \                                                                                                                                             
    -DarchetypeGroupId=com.atlassian.bamboo -DarchetypeArtifactId=bamboo-specs-archetype \
    -DarchetypeVersion=6.0.3 \
    -DgroupId=com.atlassian.bamboo -DartifactId=bamboo-specs-tutorial -Dversion=1.0.0-SNAPSHOT \
    -Dpackage=tutorial -Dtemplate=minimal
{code} 

It fails with following error:
{noformat}
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-archetype-plugin:3.0.1:generate (default-cli) on project standalone-pom: The desired archetype does not exist (com.atlassian.bamboo:bamboo-specs-archetype:6.0.3) -> [Help 1]
{noformat}

h2. How to fix

Bamboo 6.0.3 contained fix for high impact bug (BAM-18442) and wasn't related to any changes with Bamboo Specs thus Bamboo 6.0.3 works with Bamboo Specs 6.0.2.
Please use archetypeVersion 6.0.2 to properly create tutorial project and use Bamboo Specs against Bamboo 6.0.2

{code}
mvn archetype:generate -B \
    -DarchetypeGroupId=com.atlassian.bamboo -DarchetypeArtifactId=bamboo-specs-archetype \
    -DarchetypeVersion=6.0.2 \
    -DgroupId=com.atlassian.bamboo -DartifactId=bamboo-specs-tutorial -Dversion=1.0.0-SNAPSHOT \
    -Dpackage=tutorial -Dtemplate=minimal
{code}
fields.summary: Bamboo Specs archetype 6.0.3 (com.atlassian.bamboo:bamboo-specs-archetype:6.0.3) doesn't exist

fields.description: Currently only administrative users can access build dashboard at [http://bamboo-host:8085/currentActivity.action] but often developers curious about why their build job waits when it will start. It would be nice to permit access to this page other than administrators.
fields.summary: View Build Activity Permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The committer info in {{Administration >> Overview >> Repository settings}} will be sent with any Automatic Branch Merging. If users have any commit validation in place, this will cause the push to fail.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the committer information to override the global Commit info
h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround is to update the details in {{Administration >> Overview >> Repository settings}} before each build with Automatic Branch Merging
fields.summary: Allow Bamboo committer details to be used for automatic merge

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Currently, Bamboo run schedule deployment taking the latest success build as its source plan.
* Required running the latest successful build from current day

h3. Scenario
h4. Scenario A
Lets assume the following scenario:
||buildResult||completedDate||buildStatus||
|{color:blue}PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-19{color}|2017-06-{color:bulue}17{color}|(/) {color:green}Success{color}|
|PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-20|2017-06-{color:bulue}17{color}|(x) {color:red}Failure{color}|
* Today's date is 2017-06-{color:bulue}17{color} and it is 4:59 PM, almost time for our *scheduled* deployment trigger to run.
* then it is 5 PM and schedule deployment gets triggered
* Bamboo will use the latest (/) {color:green}Successful{color} build (e.g. {color:blue}PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-19{color}) as source for the deployment.

h4. Scenario B
Lets assume the following scenario (_based on above_):
||buildResult||completedDate||buildStatus||
|{color:blue}PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-19{color}|2017-06-17|(/) {color:green}Success{color}|
|PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-20|2017-06-17|(x) {color:red}Failure{color}|
|PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-20|2017-06-{color:bulue}18{color}|(x) {color:red}Failure{color}|
* Today's date is 2017-06-{color:bulue}18{color} and it is 4:59 PM, almost time for our *scheduled* deployment trigger to run.
* then it is 5 PM

Bamboo should not trigger the deployment since there is/are no (/) {color:green}Success{color} build(s) on current day. *However*, Bamboo will *continue on* using the latest (/) {color:green}Successful{color} build (e.g. {color:blue}PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-19{color}) as source for the deployment, *even though that build is not from current day*.

h3. Suggestion
Adding a triggering option to run a Scheduled deployment if successful build is from current day.
fields.summary: Deployment scheduled trigger run based on successful build from current day

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When Bamboo change detection fails with the error below, there is no notification in the UI. It shows that the "reason for not starting is unknown"
{noformat}Cannot determine head revision of ''foo'' on branch ''bar''. Branch has probably been removed.{noformat}
h3. Suggested Solution
Show this, and similar errors, in the UI.
h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this time. Please check the {{<bamboo-home>/logs/atlassian-bamboo.log}} for change detection errors.
fields.summary: Surface "Cannot determine Head" errors to Bamboo UI

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When I change my password in my Bamboo Profile panel, I expect it to show a confirmation pop-up that says my Password is updated.  

Currently, when the change password button is clicked, it just goes back to the User Profile page and I get no notification that says my Password is successfully updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Change Password" in User Profile page
 # Enter your current password and new password and click "Change password" button.

h3. Suggested Solution

I expect a confirmation message in a popup that confirms that my password is updated. Currently, there is no way that we can confirm if my password is successfully updated. It just goes back to the User Profile page.
fields.summary: Add a Password change confirmation popup upon a successful update

fields.description:
We plan to use Bamboo-specs to manage our plans, but our Bamboo instance is not connected to the Internet. The documentation and the workflow depends on a Internet access.

The documentation and tooling shall take in account the offline use case.
fields.summary: Using Bamboo-specs Offline

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upgrading Bamboo 5.13.2 to Bamboo 6.0.3 connected to Oracle 12 will have error "Cannot update schema" when adding foreign key

h3. Environment
Oracle 12.1.0.2 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Bamboo 5.13.2 to Oracle server
# Upgrade Bamboo 5.13.2 to Bamboo 6.0.3

h3. Expected Results
The upgrade will proceed without problem

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2017-06-19 17:02:19,389 FATAL [localhost-startStop-1] [UpgradeLauncher] Failed to initialise Bamboo container
com.atlassian.config.ConfigurationException: Cannot update schema
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.hibernate.BambooSchemaHelper.updateSchemaIfNeeded(BambooSchemaHelper.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.upgradeAndStartBamboo(UpgradeLauncher.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.contextInitialized(UpgradeLauncher.java:42)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4842)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5303)
	at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:147)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1407)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1397)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.hibernate.tool.schema.spi.SchemaManagementException: Unable to execute schema management to JDBC target [alter table EXTERNAL_MEMBERS add constraint FK_8l06alwmlyit7hw9h9yeiy67n foreign key (GROUPID) references GROUPS]
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.TargetDatabaseImpl.accept(TargetDatabaseImpl.java:59)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.applySqlString(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:431)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.applySqlStrings(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:420)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.applyForeignKeys(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:386)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.doMigrationToTargets(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:214)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.doMigration(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:60)
	at org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate.execute(SchemaUpdate.java:134)
	at org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate.execute(SchemaUpdate.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.hibernate.BambooSchemaHelper.updateSchemaIfNeeded(BambooSchemaHelper.java:32)
	... 11 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-02275: such a referential constraint already exists in the table
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Running the SQL in the following lines in the log will return results that the previous foreign keys still exist:
{noformat}
2017-06-19 16:57:11,614 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 51509 : Drop all FK constraints created by an older Hibernate version (bootstrap)
2017-06-19 16:57:11,614 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractUpgradeManager] ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2017-06-19 16:57:11,621 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [AbstractDbmsBean] Detected schema: KLFOONG
...
2017-06-19 16:58:34,764 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [JdbcUtils] Executing: [select TC.CONSTRAINT_NAME, CCU.COLUMN_NAME, TC.CONSTRAINT_TYPE   from ALL_CONSTRAINTS TC   join ALL_CONS_COLUMNS CCU        on TC.TABLE_NAME = CCU.TABLE_NAME        and TC.CONSTRAINT_NAME = CCU.CONSTRAINT_NAME where upper(TC.TABLE_NAME) = 'EXTERNAL_MEMBERS' and TC.OWNER = 'KLFOONG' ]
{noformat}
|| CONSTRAINT_NAME || COLUMN_NAME || CONSTRAINT_TYPE ||
| FK_HBR9I9D2DCT3A205RHH82Y555 | EXTENTITYID | R | 
| FK_O35Y9WAFG8GXRHFEDX6P840A9 | GROUPID | R | 
| SYS_C005380 | EXTENTITYID | C | 
| SYS_C005381 | GROUPID | C | 
| SYS_C005382 | EXTENTITYID | P | 
| SYS_C005382 | GROUPID | P |
* The same error happens to the following foreign keys:
** EXTERNAL_MEMBERS - FK_O35Y9WAFG8GXRHFEDX6P840A9
** EXTERNAL_MEMBERS - FK_HBR9I9D2DCT3A205RHH82Y555
** LOCAL_MEMBERS - FK_STJXT95AV33TMIYD4XTF68NHC
** LOCAL_MEMBERS - FK_KBAPW8J5EJXOLEMECF1P86P83
** VARIABLESTOAUTOINCREMENT - FK_I5XELAPGKULQ7LQOVOWE4IRBC

h3.Workaround
# Run the following SQL manually to delete the foreign keys:
{code:sql}
ALTER TABLE EXTERNAL_MEMBERS DROP CONSTRAINT FK_O35Y9WAFG8GXRHFEDX6P840A9;
ALTER TABLE EXTERNAL_MEMBERS DROP CONSTRAINT FK_HBR9I9D2DCT3A205RHH82Y555;
ALTER TABLE LOCAL_MEMBERS DROP CONSTRAINT FK_STJXT95AV33TMIYD4XTF68NHC;
ALTER TABLE LOCAL_MEMBERS DROP CONSTRAINT FK_KBAPW8J5EJXOLEMECF1P86P83;
ALTER TABLE VARIABLESTOAUTOINCREMENT DROP CONSTRAINT FK_I5XELAPGKULQ7LQOVOWE4IRBC;
{code}
# Restart Bamboo to continue with the upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Summary
BambooSpecs requires a non-NULL Destination Directory for Bamboo artifacts. 
Since Oracle treats empty strings as NULLs, if the default empty string is used, an error is thrown when viewing the Plan as Bamboo Specs

h3. Environment
* Bamboo 6.0.0+
* Oracle Database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Plan with a Job which creates a Shared artifact
# Create a second Job in the Plan that has the Artifact as a dependency
# Leave "Destination Directory" empty
# View plan as Bamboo Specs

h3. Expected Results
Destination directory shows "Root of working directory" and the Bamboo Specs appears as expected

h3. Actual Results
The export fails with the following exception in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:
{noformat}
2017-06-15 11:27:13,916 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-39] [ViewPlanSpecs] Argument destination can not be null.
com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.exceptions.PropertiesValidationException: Argument destination can not be null.
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.validators.common.ImporterUtils.checkNotNull(ImporterUtils.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.builders.plan.artifact.ArtifactSubscription.destination(ArtifactSubscription.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.configuration.external.exporters.ArtifactExporterImpl.toSpecsEntity(ArtifactExporterImpl.java:25){noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
Update the Artifact dependency's "Destination directory" to be {{.}} (period/full stop), which is a shortcut for "Root of working directory"
fields.summary: NULL "Destination Directory" on Oracle

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The document [Locating important directories and files |https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/locating-important-directories-and-files-289277247.html] shows the path to artifacts with the following expression:
{noformat}
artifacts/PLAN_KEY/shared/build-BUILD_NUMBER/
{noformat}
This information is no longer true for the newer versions. There was a change due to Storage tag should be available from build variables.

The PLAN_KEY matched the PLAN-KEY in the past but now is just *plan-XXXX* (the name *plan* is fixed and do not here any relation with the name of the plan like it was in the past. It is also followed by a number not directly explicit in the UI.
Before it was simple for the users to know the plan name but now they need to figure out the correct folder by checking the $\{bamboo.plan.storageTag} variable.

More information can be found in this KB: [Artifacts in Bamboo Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamkb/artifacts-in-bamboo-server-829052138.html]
h3. Suggested Solution

Change the documentation so this information is somehow present there. It should be something like:
{noformat}
artifacts/plan-xxxxx/shared/build-BUILD_NUMBER/
{noformat}
With a description of what means the *plan-xxxxx* value.
fields.summary: Fix details about artifacts plan storage folder

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when users attempt to login, Bamboo will attempt an insert into the {{AUTH_ATTEMPT_INFO}} table. When this fails, for example due to the username exceeding 255 characters, users see a 500 error and a full Bamboo stack trace.

h3. Suggested Solution
Validate the entries at the frontend before the insert, and throw errors such as "The username entered is too long" if that is the case.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Validate login attempts before inserting into AUTH_ATTEMPT_INFO

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Cloud applications, Site Admins can log in as any user with privileges under the Site Admin level. This is not available in Server.
h3. Suggested Solution
Port this feature to Server. 
h3. Workaround
Currently, this requires the admin to either:
* Log out and then log in as the other user; or
* Start a new browsing Session in another browser or Incognito/Private Browsing window and log in; or
* Use a Plugin such as [SU for Bamboo|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.thepluginpeople.bamboo.bamboo-su/server/overview]
fields.summary: "Log in as User" feature in Server

h3. Problem Definition
There is no REST API to download artifacts from the Bamboo server.
h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Workaround
You can use {{wget}} to download this through the HTTP URL, with the path to the artifact encoded.
For example:
{noformat}/artifact/<BUILD_KEY>/path/to/artifact{noformat}
{noformat}%2Fartifact%2F<BUILD_KEY>%2Fpath%2Fto%2Fartifact{noformat}

With this, please run:
{code}wget "<bamboo-url>/userlogin.action?os_username=********&os_password=******&os_destination=%2Fartifact%2F<BUILD_KEY>%2Fpath%2Fto%2Fartifact" -O <artifact_local_name>{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When SCPing an artifact of multiple nested directories + files and the location of the artifact is not defined as the root of the working directory; the location directory is also created at the destination, when instead we just want the contents of the location to be copied (not the location directory itself). 

It's easier to articulate with the example below.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Source directory:
{code}
+ dir working_directory
|  + dir build
|    + file index.html
|    + dir css
|      + file style.css
{code}
# Artifact definition:
{code}* Location: build
* Copy pattern: **{code}
# SCP Task to copy Artifact to a remote path: {{/var/www/public_html}} (ensure this path exists on the remote or we will hit BAM-14439 which will change the result)

h3. Expected Results
The remote should end up with: {{/var/www/public_html/index.html}}

h3. Actual Results
The remote ends up with {{/var/www/public_html/build/index.html}}
 
h3. Notes
* This behavior is completely different (and aligns with what's expected) if in the above example, the {{css}} subdirectory and {{style.css}} do not exist. 
* The difference in the above scenario, seems to be the *recursive copy*. It's like performing: 
** {{scp -r build user@host:/var/www/public_html}} instead of performing:
** {{scp -r build/* user@host:/var/www/public_html}}
* The Artifact Download task downloads the same artifact as expected, without creating the {{build}} directory.
* If the target directory (e.g. {{public_html}}) doesn't exist, the {{build}} folder isn't created (BAM-14439)
* If the same artifact is downloaded in a separate stage into the root of the working directory, SCP copies it as expected.

h3.Workaround
* Create a *separate* stage in the plan which has:
** Artifact Download task: This will download the artifact we were previously SCPing, to the root of the working directory of the new stage. You'll need to make sure the definition of the previous artifact is shared so it can be retrieved in another stage.
** SCP task that references the Artifact downloaded and copies it to the remote location.

or
* Use a script task to SCP the files like this example:
{code}
sshpass -p ${bamboo.scp_password} scp -r build/* user@host:/var/www/public_html
{code}
fields.summary: SCP of artifact with nested subdirectory results in the location folder also being created at the remote

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A regression in the Apache HTTPClient shipped with Bamboo 6.0.2 causes a ClassCastException when publishing an artifact to Bamboo and the SSL certificate for the server contains ASN.1 encoded entries for the Subject Alternate Name (e.g. Microsoft UPNs):
* https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HTTPCLIENT-1836

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo-agent.log file:
{noformat}
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 2017-06-06 20:41:35,046 WARN [0-BAM::Remote Agent::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [AbstractArtifactManager] [B cannot be cast to java.lang.String
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | java.lang.ClassCastException: [B cannot be cast to java.lang.String
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.DefaultHostnameVerifier.getSubjectAltNames(DefaultHostnameVerifier.java:309)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.DefaultHostnameVerifier.verify(DefaultHostnameVerifier.java:112)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.DefaultHostnameVerifier.verify(DefaultHostnameVerifier.java:99)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.verifyHostname(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:463)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.createLayeredSocket(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:397)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.conn.ssl.SSLConnectionSocketFactory.connectSocket(SSLConnectionSocketFactory.java:355)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.connect(DefaultHttpClientConnectionOperator.java:142)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.conn.PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.connect(PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager.java:359)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.establishRoute(MainClientExec.java:381)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.MainClientExec.execute(MainClientExec.java:237)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.ProtocolExec.execute(ProtocolExec.java:185)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RetryExec.execute(RetryExec.java:89)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.execchain.RedirectExec.execute(RedirectExec.java:111)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.client.InternalHttpClient.doExecute(InternalHttpClient.java:185)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:83)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:108)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2017/06/06 20:41:35 | 	at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:56)
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
* Regenerate the certificates to contain only DNS entries rather than the UPNs or
* The regression is in Apache HTTPClient 4.5.3, so you could manually upgrade or downgrade the Apache HTTPClient to 4.5.4 or 4.5.2. The library is stored in {{<bamboo-install>/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/lib/}}. 
** Please note, these versions of the library are untested with current releases of Bamboo but some users have had success with this workaround.
fields.summary: HTTPClient throws ClassCastException when agent publishes artifact to Bamboo Server with Microsoft UPNs in the certificate

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SCP and SSH tasks are not working in Bamboo 6.0.2.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a plan with SCP task to copy some files from a local path to a remote path
# Run the plan

h3. Expected Results
The SCP and SSH tasks are able to establish a connection, build succeeds.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the build log with private key authentication:
{noformat}
simple	06-Jun-2017 20:29:50	Starting task 'SCP' of type 'com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-scp-plugin:scptask'
simple	06-Jun-2017 20:29:50	Connecting to host on port: 2222
error	06-Jun-2017 20:29:50	Failed to connect to host
error	06-Jun-2017 20:29:51	net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportException: BouncyCastle is required to read a key of type ecdsa-sha2-nistp256
error	06-Jun-2017 20:29:51		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportException$1.chain(TransportException.java:33)
error	06-Jun-2017 20:29:51		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportException$1.chain(TransportException.java:27)
error	06-Jun-2017 20:29:51		at net.schmizz.concurrent.Promise.deliverError(Promise.java:96)
error	06-Jun-2017 20:29:51		at net.schmizz.concurrent.Event.deliverError(Event.java:74)
{noformat}

With password authentication:
{code}
simple	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00	Connecting to localhost on port: 22
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00	Failed to connect to host
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00	net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportException: Unable to reach a settlement: [diffie-hellman-group1-sha1, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha1] and [curve25519-sha256@libssh.org, ecdh-sha2-nistp256, ecdh-sha2-nistp384, ecdh-sha2-nistp521, diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256, diffie-hellman-group14-sha1]
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Proposal.firstMatch(Proposal.java:145)
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Proposal.negotiate(Proposal.java:128)
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.KeyExchanger.gotKexInit(KeyExchanger.java:218)
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.KeyExchanger.handle(KeyExchanger.java:350)
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.TransportImpl.handle(TransportImpl.java:503)
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Decoder.decode(Decoder.java:102)
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Decoder.received(Decoder.java:170)
error	07-Jun-2017 13:33:00		at net.schmizz.sshj.transport.Reader.run(Reader.java:59)
{code}

h3. Notes
* Affects both password and private key authentication

h3.Workaround

# Stop Bamboo
# Download  [^bamboo-scp-plugin-6.0.1.jar] 
# Go to {{<bamboo_install>/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/}}
# Move the old plugin, {{bamboo-scp-plugin-6.0.0.jar}} out of that directory into a non-Bamboo location (for simple backup purposes)
# Place the fixed plugin,  [^bamboo-scp-plugin-6.0.1.jar], into that directory.
# Start Bamboo

Alternate workaround:
# Disable the SCP / SSH task
# Add a script task the performs the equivalent functions on command-line. Example below which uses password authentication to recursively copy a local path to a remote path (password in the below example is substituted from a Bamboo Plan variable):
{code}
sshpass -p ${bamboo.scp_password} scp -r local/path/ user@host:/remote/path
{code}
fields.summary: SSH / SCP tasks no longer working in Bamboo 6.0.2

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Build tests for builds that were run in Bamboo 5.13.2 are not displayed after upgrade to 5.15.5 nor 6.0.2

h3. Environment
- Any OS
- Any DB
- Bamboo 5.13.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Bamboo 5.13.2, create a plan with a repository associated with maven tests.
# Run the build, in the Tests tab, tests are listed correctly.
# Perform an upgrade to 5.15.5 or 6.0.2
# Open the build that was run before the upgrade.

h3. Expected Results
Tests listed as before

h3. Actual Results
Empty list.

 !Screen Shot 2017-06-06 at 16.10.00.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
When Bamboo uses LDAP as an user base the _Atlassian user_ library might return _null_ when there's some problem in retrieving results from LDAP (like intermittent connectivity problems). Upper layer considers _null_ response as _No such user_. 

Because of that such result can be cached and Bamboo won't retry to query for some particular user before cache eviction. Effective, some users may not be able to login for an hour or more, because Bamboo lost connection to LDAP server to couple of minutes.
fields.summary: Atlassian user library should rethrow exception in case of LDAP errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, Bamboo provides two options of restraining agents to run projects, plans, jobs, deployment or environment:
* [Dedicating an agent|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Dedicating+an+agent]
* [Configuring a job's requirements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+a+job%27s+requirements]

*However*, Bamboo does not provide a way to enforce projects, plans, jobs, deployment or environment to not run against agent(s).

h3. Suggestion
h4. Dedicating
Under {color:blue}Bamboo administration >> Agents >> \[Agent\] >> Dedicate agent{color} a checkbox should be added making possible the *not* option, as a result we would have:
||{color:blue}Negate{color}||Type||Name||
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Build project|Project|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Build plan|Project > Plan|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Build job|Project > Plan > Job|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Deployment project|Deployment|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Deployment environment|Deployment > Environment|

As a result, the following option become possible:
||Negate||Type||Description||
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Build project|Agent *will not* build from Build project|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Build plan|Agent *will not* build from Build plan|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Build job|Agent *will not* build from Build job|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Deployment project|Agent *will not* build from Deployment project|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|Deployment environment|Agent *will not* build from Deployment environment|

h4. Requirements
Under {color:blue}Plan configuration >> \[Stage\] >> \[Job\] >> Requirements{color} tab a checkbox should be added making possible the *not* option, as a result we would have:
||Required capability||{color:blue}Negate{color}||Condition||
|\[Search for capability\]|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|\[exists\]|
|\[Search for capability\]|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|\[equals\]|
|\[Search for capability\]|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|\[matches\]|

As a result, the following options become possible:
||Negate||Condition||Description||
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|exists|When capability *does not* exsist in agent|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|equals|When capability *is not* equals as in agent|
|\[ {color:blue}x{color} \]|matches|When capability *does not* match in agent|
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to prevent agent from running projects, plans, jobs, deployment or environment
Deployment versions are not incremented correctly if naming also contains a variable

fields.description:
One of the Subversion repositories in our company is (unfortunately) very large.

I have setup a linked repository that uses a Bamboo variable in the repository URL so that a plan doesn't have to checkout the entire repository.

However currently this poses a problem if a plan needs to checkout two or more parts of this large repository. When you add a second repository to the plan and choose 'link existing', the concerned linked repository is not shown in the list of available linked repositories.

Please allow to add a linked repository to a plan more than once, at least for Subversion repositories.
fields.summary: Allow to add linked repository to a plan more than once

fields.description:
h2. Summary

AWS CodeDeploy task displays limited list of AWS regions

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 
 # Go to plan configuration
 # Add AWS CodeDeploy task

h2. Expected Results

Configuration will allow to use all regions where AWS CodeDeploy is supported

h2. Actual Results

Limited list of regions is displayed (eu-west-2 / London missing)

h2. Workaround

No workaround

h2. Suggested Solution

Obtain list of supported regions from [https://pricing.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/offers/v1.0/aws/AWSCodeDeploy/current/region_index.json] which will avoid a Bamboo release (and associated delay) every time AWS launch a new region.  This is a recurring issue.
fields.summary: AWS CodeDeploy is not displaying all regions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a test needs to run for a long time, the duration for that test in the results will be displayed incorrectly.

h3. Environment
- Tested in Bamboo 5.15.5 and 6.0.0.
- Any OS.
- Any DB.
- Development project with tests that a build tool (example maven) can execute.
 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a Plan with a repository to a project that includes build tool configuration (maven project) and tests.
# Configure a maven task that runs tests.
# Configure a test task to Parse results.
# Make sure to have a test that will take at least 1000 seconds to run (in my environment, my test took 1200 seconds to complete).

h3. Expected Results
Duration displayed correctly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using JGit in Bamboo, a Git repository in Bamboo and pointing the repository URL to a GitLab with the format {{https://gitlab.com/user/repository}} (note the missing {{.git}} extension) will fail with 404 not found at build time despite the connection testing successful.

h3. Environment
* JGit

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove any native git capabilities
# Setup a git repository pointed to https://gitlab.com/user/repository
# Setup a plan to use that repository
# Build

h3. Expected Results
The build succeeds

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException : : Cannot fetch branch '+refs/heads/master:refs/heads/master' from 'https://gitlab.com/user/repository' to source directory 'D:\Bamboo\bamboo-home\xml-data\build-dir_git-repositories-cache\2df12e5dbdbc12c30cf57c2d26e8784bd25a9d3d'. https://gitlab.com/user/repository: 404 Not Found
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
* Install native git and ensure it is defined as a Bamboo capability at *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Server Capabilities*

Or if you need to use JGit:
* Change the repository URL to include the {{.git}} extension. Example: {{https://gitlab.com/user/repository.git}}
fields.summary: GitLab URLs in the format https://gitlab.com/user/repository fail with 404 not found when using JGit

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Current plan details received from REST API doesn't include list of child dependencies.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add in the child dependencies to the plan details
fields.summary: Include child dependencies for plan details via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there's no way to retrieve a list of build results associated with a label via a REST API. You can use the below API and filter for label:
{code}
https://bamboo/rest/api/latest/result.json?label=release
{code}

However, as per the documentation -- it only works for top level plans. It does not include *plan branch* results.

The below Bamboo UI does show all results per label (even branches):
*  https://bamboo/browse/label/release

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the REST endpoint {{https://bamboo/rest/api/latest/result.json?label=release}} to allow retrieval of plan branch results too.
fields.summary: Introduce a new endpoint or improve existing to retrieve all results associated with a label in REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users are currently unable to deploy to the China (Beijing – cn-north-1) region using the AWS CodeDeploy task.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement support for the China (Beijing) AWS region

h3. Workaround
There is currently no workaround for this
fields.summary: Allow deployment using CodeDeploy tasks to China (Beijing) region

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Default repository permissions is to "Allow all users to reuse the configuration of this repository" when creating a new project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to change the default setting to "Only you are allowed to reuse the configuration of this repository"

h3. Why this is important
When creating new projects, admins might leave default and can cause security issues for repositories that need to be restricted.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to bulk edit repository permissions and default to "Only you are allowed to reuse the configuration of this repository"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we can give a user either global permissions or access to an individual Build Plan and/or Project or Deployment Project and/or Environment. Non-administrator users with Global permissions may not have these permissions on all Plans or Environments so we need to assign them manually.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add functionality to bulk add individual permissions to Bamboo, such as check boxes on Global Permissions to also add this to all Build Plans and Deployment Projects/Environments.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Ability to bulk add users/groups to builds/deployment plans and projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While selecting the Source plan for Artifact download task there is less validation for plan names if the symbol “-“ is used anywhere in between the name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your plan configuration and add the Artifact Download task to it.
 # In Source Plan, input any random characters along with the symbol “-“ in between it.

The first character for the source plan name can be any alphanumeric character except the symbol “-"
and then after the symbol “-“ you can use any combination of alphanumeric characters for the source plan name.

h3. Expected Results
There should be Source plan validation while selecting or inputting the same for Artifact download task.

h3. Actual Results
No validation for the Source plan name for Artifact download task, when the symbol “-“ is used in between the Source plan name.
fields.summary: Less validation with Source plan name in Artifact download task.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, I want to be able to manage users and groups remotely using REST API

h3. Suggested Solution
Create REST endpoints to manage the most common tasks involving user configuration
 
h3. Workaround
Use an external user repository and perform the operations directly into that repository
fields.summary: Add REST endpoint to manage users and groups remotely

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The current dedicated agent functionality is a two way relationship.  The agent is dedicated to the plan or build AND the plan or build is dedicated to the agent.  This is a one to one relationship.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if other agents can perform build on a plan that have agent dedication, or agent priority.  A Agent would be defined in a priority Queue.  Then if the plan or build requires an Agent, Agents in this que will be chosen first.  If none of these agents are available, then other Agents could then be used in the queue'd. 

h3. Why this is important
When Bamboo becomes busy, administrators can define agents that *can not* be used by there plans and builds.  This way, this queue always has a group of agents dedicated to this plan or build.  But this plan or build could also use the other Agents when this plan requires it.  This plan or build could be high enough priority that it would need to overflow into the other Agents.
fields.summary: Agent priority queue or One way agent dedication

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The MSTest Runner Task only supports some tests, whereas the VSTest Runner Task provides support for some more complex test execution.
Right now, there is no information on which Runner to use in which situation

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a note on the MSTest Runner and VSTest Runner Tasks showing the different uses.
fields.summary: Add info to MSTest Runner

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Stopping a environment deployment that is running a Deploy Tomcat Application task does not work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Deploy Tomcat Application task into a Deployment Environment
# Run the deployment
# During Deploy Tomcat Application task, click on "Stop deployment" button

h3. Expected Results
The deployment will stop

h3. Actual Results
The deployment couldn't be stopped. Deploy Tomcat Application task will continue until it get a result 
 
h3. Notes
* If the same task is used in Build Plan, it can be stopped
* If the Tomcat server have performance issue, Deploy Tomcat Application task will still continue until it get a response

h3.Workaround
If Tomcat server have performance issue, restart Bamboo or the Tomcat server to stop the deployment process in Bamboo
fields.summary: Deploy Tomcat Application task fail to be stopped in deployment project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the *Commits* page under Releases can only compare releases created from the same branch

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the ability to compare releases across multiple branches

h3. Workaround
Use the SQL query defined in:
[How to find Changeset IDs included in Deployment Versions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/How+to+find+Changeset+IDs+included+in+Deployment+Versions]
fields.summary: Ability to Compare Releases from different Branches

fields.description:
Bamboo allows one to define a Linked Repository using GitHub. But does not provide a way to setup a *Web Repository* that can be used to view commits. 

This is a very desirable feature as it makes it easy to see what code changes might have broken a build.

If Bamboo can easily format a URL to link to Fisheye or Bitbucket, linking to GitHub is just as easy.
fields.summary: Provide a Web Repository Link to GitHub

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When publishing a plan with a trigger (e.g. Bitbucket Server repository triggered) in Bamboo Specs, Bamboo will run a first build of the plan. This is aligned with how the UI operates.

h3. Suggested Solution
Property to suppress the first build of the plan, so that it only occurs on a repository commit or manual build.
 
h3. Workaround 
Remove the trigger and add it on a second publish.
fields.summary: Suppress first build action when publishing from Bamboo Specs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Bamboo Specs configuration with a Repository type that does not support automatic branching
# Run Bamboo Specs configuration to generate plan

h3. Expected Results
Specs is successful, with the plan generated
h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the logs:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.exceptions.PropertiesValidationException: Plan branch / workflow: Default plan repository doesn't support 'BRANCH' workflow. Don't use this setting or choose another repository as default
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for this issue
fields.summary: Some Repository Types are not imported using Specs

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results

# Delete and re-create the NUnit task configuration

fields.description:
Bamboo did not correctly check if a user creating a deployment project had the edit permission and therefore the rights to do so. An attacker who can login to Bamboo as a user without the edit permission for deployment projects is able to use this vulnerability, provided there is an existing plan with a green build, to create a deployment project and execute arbitrary code on an available Bamboo Agent. By default a local agent is enabled this means that code execution can occur on the system hosting Bamboo as the user running Bamboo.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * Versions of Bamboo starting with 5.0.0 before 5.15.7 (the fixed version for 5.15.x) and from 6.0.0 before 6.0.1 (the fixed version for 6.0.x) are affected by this vulnerability.

 

*Fix:*
 * *Bamboo* 6.0.3 is available to download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download].
 * *Bamboo* 5.15.7 is available to download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download-archives].

 

*Acknowledgements*
 Atlassian would like to credit Iordache Cosmin (@inhibitor181) for reporting this issue to us.

 

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/KgwUNg].
fields.summary: Incorrect permission check for deployment projects (CVE-2017-8907)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Change forgotten password reset form is no longer working in Bamboo 6.0. After entering a new password and hitting confirm, the form POSTs back to itself with no confirmation of anything changing. The password does not change.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Bamboo 6.0 + Mail server configured
# Setup a user with a valid email address that you have access to
# Logout
# On the login screen, goto 'Can't access your account?'
# Enter the username of the user that was setup in step 2 to perform password reset for and confirm
# Email will be sent to that user with a password reset link, goto that link.
# Enter new password and hit confirm

h3. Expected Results
Confirmation screen is displayed letting the user know password has changed
Password is changed

h3. Actual Results
Form POSTs back to itself, no confirmation is displayed and password doesn't change.
 
h3.Workaround
A Bamboo administrator can set a new password via *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Users*. This password can then be changed by the user at *Profile > Change password* once logged in.

If the password for the local administrator is lost and needs to be manually reset, the below knowledge base article has steps to regain access:
* [Restoring passwords to recover admin users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/restoring-passwords-to-recover-admin-users-289277354.html]
fields.summary: Change forgotten password form not working in Bamboo 6.0

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the Artifact Download Build Task, the "greater than" symbol in the *Source plan* field displays incorrectly on Chrome and Firefox as *{{â€º}}*. For example:
{noformat}Project â€º Plan{noformat}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Bamboo in Chrome or Firefox
# Add or edit an Artifact Download Task in a Build Plan
# Select a Source plan from the dropdown list
# Check the Source plan field

h3. Expected Results
The names are encoded correctly, and show
{noformat}Project > Plan{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The UI shows:
{noformat}Project â€º Plan{noformat}

h3.Workaround
(i) If you are on Windows, this character appears correctly in IE11.
h4. Linux/Mac OS X and Windows Console
# Stop Bamboo
# Edit {{<bamboo-install>/bin/setenv.(sh|bat)}} to add {{-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8}} to *JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS*
{code:title=Unix example}
JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8"
{code}
{code:title=Windows example}
set JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS="-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -Dsun.jnu.encoding=UTF-8"
{code}

h4. Windows Service
# Stop Bamboo
# Open the Tomcat configuration for the Bamboo Service by running the {{tomcat8w}} command on the command line (cmd.exe) – for example:
{code}tomcat8w //ES//Bamboo{code}
# Click on the Java tab to see the list of current start-up options
# Add the following to the *Java Options* field:

fields.description:
Artifact passing should preserve file attributes of the artifacts it captures.

In my case a directory is copied to target,  all the target file dates are set to current date in  xml-data\build-dir\#-#\
fields.summary: Artifact passing should preserve file attributes

fields.description:
It would be useful to show the results of already executed tests during a build.

In the case of massive Selenium tests a build could take hours to finish. if you want to fix failed tests, you have to wait until the complete build is finished to view the tests result.

I suggest to show the tests result view that is currently shown on a build result on the build progress view (Maybe with pending on the tests which are not executed yet).
fields.summary: Show tests result of executed tests during a build
Improve Bamboo Specs error logging when Bamboo is completing background deletion on a plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an admin I would like to save the time often spent with Bamboo upgrades and its common issues.
h3. Suggested Solution

The Bamboo upgrade could:
 # Be started from the UI (admin area) and handle the next changes in case the constraints are met *OR*
 # Highlighting any details the admin will need to work on before the upgrade can be performed:
 ** License update, in case it is needed
 ** Modified files on installer directory if they cannot be automatically migrated (maybe the Tomcat config should be migrated to the home directory)
 ** Minimum database version needed
 ** Minimum JDK version needed
 ** Minimum JVM system resources need
In other words checking what is needed for the upgrade and providing some feedback in case it cannot be done automatically
 ** Disk space check,
 # Give some options for post-upgrade actions.

 * Clean up prior logs and prior installs (on windows).
 * Ability to clean up old deploys and builds.
fields.summary: Upgrade support through UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no API endpoint to manage repositories in Bamboo.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a REST solution to create, update and get information from repositories.
We could wrapper existing internal endpoints like: {{<bamboo-url>/admin/createLinkedRepository.action}}

h3. Workaround
Please create repositories manually.
fields.summary: REST API for managing Repositories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the scheduled backup runs and tries to overwrite an existing backup output file, it will throw an error if there are external (to Bamboo) files present.


h3. Environment
Any

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a file in, for example, <bamboo-home>/xml-data/configuration.
# Schedule a backup. The name format such be such for the file to be overwritten in the future.
# Schedule the backup to run. A zip file is created.
# Schedule the backup to run again.
# An error will occur.

h3. Expected Results
Zip file created, overwriting the existing one. 

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
2017-05-18 13:05:03,910 INFO [scheduler_Worker-6] [XmlMigrator] Zipping config dir:/home/mate/Downloads/bamboo-home6/backups/bamboo_backup_2017_05.zip/configuration
2017-05-18 13:05:04,046 INFO [scheduler_Worker-6] [XmlMigrator] Ensuring the the file has been unmounted
2017-05-18 13:05:04,078 INFO [scheduler_Worker-6] [XmlMigrator] Unmounted /home/mate/Downloads/bamboo-home6/backups/bamboo_backup_2017_05.zip
2017-05-18 13:05:04,094 INFO [scheduler_Worker-6] [ServerLifecycleManagerImpl] Server state changed to 'RUNNING' from 'PAUSED'
2017-05-18 13:05:04,094 ERROR [scheduler_Worker-6] [ScheduledBackupJob] java.io.IOException: /home/mate/Downloads/bamboo-home6/backups/bamboo_backup_2017_05.zip/configuration/paddle-2.0.jar (not a file)
java.io.IOException: /home/mate/Downloads/bamboo-home6/backups/bamboo_backup_2017_05.zip/configuration/paddle-2.0.jar (not a file)
	at de.schlichtherle.truezip.file.TBIO.cp_r0(TBIO.java:178)
	at de.schlichtherle.truezip.file.TBIO.cp_r0(TBIO.java:169)
	at de.schlichtherle.truezip.file.TBIO.cp_r(TBIO.java:138)
	at de.schlichtherle.truezip.file.TFile.cp_rp(TFile.java:3317)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator.exportXml(XmlMigrator.java:509)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator$$FastClassBySpringCGLIB$$b6578fc7.invoke(<generated>)
	at org.springframework.cglib.proxy.MethodProxy.invoke(MethodProxy.java:204)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.CglibAopProxy$CglibMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(CglibAopProxy.java:720)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:157)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor$1.proceedWithInvocation(TransactionInterceptor.java:99)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.invokeWithinTransaction(TransactionAspectSupport.java:281)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:96)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.CglibAopProxy$DynamicAdvisedInterceptor.intercept(CglibAopProxy.java:655)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.XmlMigrator$$EnhancerBySpringCGLIB$$fb46910f.exportXml(<generated>)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.migration.ImportExportManagerImpl.bambooExport(ImportExportManagerImpl.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.configuration.ScheduledBackupJob.execute(ScheduledBackupJob.java:75)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:202)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooRunnables$1.run(BambooRunnables.java:51)

h3. Notes
A KB already exists for this issue, although it doesn't address the issue, if the user wants to override the output file. Link: [Bamboo scheduled backups fail with java.io.IOException - not a file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamkb/bamboo-scheduled-backups-fail-with-java-io-ioexception-not-a-file-859492182.html].

h3.Workaround
- The KB mentioned above.
- Using a different folder to save external files.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In versions after Bamboo 5.10.x, Remote Triggers require Trigger IP to be specified for SVN
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a linked repository on a different server to Bamboo
 # Add a new Linked SVN repository
 # Configure a Plan with a Remote Trigger – leave the Trigger IP blank
 # Configure a post-commit hook on your repository to call the trigger API
 # Commit a change to trigger the build

h3. Expected Results

As this was available in Bamboo 5.10, it is expected that the build triggers in newer versions as well
h3. Actual Results

The build does not trigger, and the below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2017-05-18 01:03:16,454 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-20] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: TriggerRemoteBuild : Build request for plan [<plan name>] originated from 172.20.52.22 which is not an allowed address : <PLAN KEY>
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Add the Trigger IP to the Trigger
fields.summary: SVN Remote Trigger now requires Trigger IP to be specified

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Plans are receiving Bitbucket pull requests, generating high CPU usage

h3. Environment

Behaviour found in Bamboo 6 and Bitbucket 5.0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Application Link with Bitbucket server.
# Problem starts as soon as Bamboo is started. 

h3. Expected Results

Normal behaviour.

h3. Actual Results
Pull requests every ~100ms, even when no triggers are configured:

Log entries:

{noformat}
2017-05-17 10:29:55,799 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-1] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan1

2017-05-17 10:29:55,799 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-1] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan1
2017-05-17 10:29:55,799 DEBUG [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan2
2017-05-17 10:29:55,799 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-1] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan1
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-1] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan1
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-1] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan1
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-3] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan2
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-3] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan2
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-3] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan2
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-3] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan2
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-3] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan2
2017-05-17 10:29:55,800 DEBUG [6-PullRequestDetectionBackgroundThread:pool-12-thread-3] [BitbucketServerPullRequestDetector] Fetched 0 open PRs from Plan2
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes



h3.Workaround
Option #1. Disable branch detection altogether
# Start Bamboo with {{atlassian.bamboo.branch.detection.disable}} system property set to true.

Option #2. This problem can be controlled by changing the branch detection interval:
# Overview -> Settings -> General configuration: Field "Branch detection interval".
# The default value is 300s. Try increasing it gradually (say 100s) until the problem is controlled.
fields.summary: High CPU usage generated by constant Bitbucket pull requests

fields.description: I have a plan which is triggered manually, but I want to create plan branches automatically from pull-requests and have them trigger builds from Bitbucket when something changes.
fields.summary: Allow Plan Branches to be triggered differently to their parent plan

fields.description:
Is there any delay between a JOB being added to a plan and the availability to get the job via the *rest/api/latest/plan/<key>* REST API?

It seems to be a problem on Bamboo 6.0.0 at least.

How can you be sure the job is available to access after a create?
fields.summary: REST API not finding job just after it was created

fields.description:
Both rest/api/latest/plan and rest/api/latest/plan/\{key} should return the plan numeric id.

planID and JobID from the build table are needed  to be able to use the <URL>/rest/api/latest/agent/assignment rest API.
fields.summary: REST APIs for plans should return the plan id

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo can not define Plan Dependencies at the Branch level. For example, we can not set a Dependency to trigger only after a build on the branch "QA".

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement dependencies for Branches as well as Master plan level
 
h3. Workaround
As a workaround, you can:
# Create a new Linked repository using the QA branch instead of the master branch
# Create new Plans for each of the QA runs
# Use the new Linked repository as the Plan Repository
fields.summary: Branch-level Dependency specification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User A has deployment permissions on environment Alpha.
Environment Beta has a trigger set to run after Alpha succeeds.
* User A does not have deployment permissions for Beta
User A is able to kick off a deployment on Beta by running a successful Alpha build

h3. Suggested Solution
Have deployment triggers honor environment permissions based on who started original deployment

h3. Why this is important
Cloning environments lead to triggers being inherited. Administers add in restrictiosn to the cloned environment, but may forget to change the trigger.
fields.summary: Deployment triggers should honor environment permssions based on who started the original deployment

fields.description:
The 'Edit Tasks' screen for Deployment plans has no context (bread crumbs) to tell me what I am looking at (for which deployment plan). As a new user to Bamboo I sometimes will keep two plans open to compare one which I am working on with a known good/working plan from another project. If I become distracted when I can return to my work it isn't clear which deployment project I am working on. 

https://bamboo.cmrclaims.com/deploy/config/configureEnvironmentTasks.action?environmentId=1
fields.summary: Bread Crumbs Needed

fields.description:
As _a maintainer of Bamboo plans_

I want _to be able to overwrite the repository setting "Use submodules" (enabled or not enabled) selectively for jobs, e.g. as setting of the "Source Code Checkout" tasks_

so that _checkout and therewith overall build times will significantly be reduced by configuring off "Use submodules" at jobs of the plan which actually do not require them._
fields.summary: Add option "Use submodules" to task "Source Code Checkout" for overwrite

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When navigating through the linked repositories page. If for some reason your user is signed off, the whole Bamboo page is prompted for login in a section of the selected repository. Even after the login the header and footer are still there. The whole page needs to be reloaded to avoid this problem.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login in Bamboo
# Open the linked repositories page
# Open a new tab in the browser with Bamboo and sign out your user
# Go back to the first tab and select any linked repository

h3. Expected Results
# User will be redirected to the login page or will be prompted with a dialog to login (but without the header many and footer)

h3. Actual Results
The following page is shown:
 !Screen Shot 2017-05-12 at 10.43.37 AM.png|thumbnail! 
Even after the login the heather is still there although the buttons don't work staying inconsistent.
 !Screen_Shot_2017-05-12_at_10_42_45_AM.png|thumbnail! 
h3.Workaround
Reload the whole page (whole browser tab)
fields.summary: Linked repository content is not correctly rendered if the user is logged out
